name: Familial Hypophosphatemic Rickets
chief_complaint: My child has been having bone pain and difficulty walking for the past few months.
treatment: regular monitoring of growth and bone development
prognosis: Good with early diagnosis and treatment, but may require lifelong management to prevent complications.
description: Familial Hypophosphatemic Rickets is an X-linked dominant disorder caused by mutations in the PHEX gene, leading to renal phosphate wasting and impaired bone mineralization. It primarily affects the skeletal system, causing rickets in children and osteomalacia in adults.
